definition[0]: a situation in which nothing happens or changes for a long period of time, and it is difficult to make decisions or know what to do, often because you are waiting for something else to happen first
example[0]: I’m in limbo now until I know whether I’ve got the job.
example[1]: the limbo of his eight years in jail
definition[1]: to be in an uncertain situation in which it is not clear what will happen next
example[2]: Investors in the shares have been left in limbo since the market tailed off.
